item.title: Making corrections in the enrollment of the bill H.R. 2647.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2010

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 234 - 188 (Roll no. 765).
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 234 - 188 (Roll no. 765).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 808.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H11115-11125; text of measure as reported in House: CR H11115)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 119.
All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. Considered as read.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-289, by Ms. Slaughter.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-289, by Ms. Slaughter.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 2647) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2010 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, to provide special pays and allowances to certain members of the Armed Forces, expand concurrent receipt of military retirement and VA disability benefits to disabled military retirees.
Sets forth the rule for consideration of the conference report on H.R. 2647 (National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2010).

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 2647) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2010 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, to provide special pays and allowances to certain members of the Armed Forces, expand concurrent receipt of military retirement and VA disability benefits to disabled military retirees, and for other purposes.

item.title: Providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 2647) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2010 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, to provide special pays and allowances to certain members of the Armed Forces, expand concurrent receipt of military retirement and VA disability benefits to disabled military retirees, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 2647) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2010 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, to provide special pays and allowances to certain members of the Armed Forces, expand concurrent receipt of military retirement and VA disability benefits to disabled military retirees, and for other purposes.

amendment.description: At the end of the resolution, add the following: "SEC. 2. Upon the adoption of the conference report the House shall be considered to have adopted the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 196) making corrections in the enrollment of the bill H.R. 2647.".
amendment.purpose: Upon the adoption of the conference report the House shall be considered to have adopted the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 196) making corrections in the enrollment of the bill H.R. 2647.

latestAction.text: On agreeing to the Slaughter amendment (A001) Agreed to by voice vote.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
